titles: Cupids victory over the virgins hearts or, Love in its colours. When Cupid's dart does pierce the heart of a fair youthful maid; she's forc'd to bend, and not contend, his laws must be obey'd. To a pleasant new play-tune; or, The maids a washing themselves. This may be printed, R.P.
publisher: Printed for I. Deacon at the angel in Guilt-spur-street,
notes: Imperfect: cropped, with loss of imprint.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: Broadsides --  England --  London --  Early works to 1800.
